psalm.title: Psalms
psalm.text:
[[Ps 116,12]]How shall I make a return to the LORD 
for all the good he has done for me?
[[Ps 116,13]]The cup of salvation I will take up, 
and I will call upon the name of the LORD.

[[Ps 116,15]]Precious in the eyes of the LORD 
is the death of his faithful ones.
[[Ps 116,16b]]I am your servant, the son of your handmaid;
[[Ps 116,16c]]you have loosed my bonds.

[[Ps 116,17]]To you will I offer sacrifice of thanksgiving, 
and I will call upon the name of the LORD.
[[Ps 116,18]]My vows to the LORD I will pay  
in the presence of all his people.

gospel.title: Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ according to Saint Matthew
gospel.text:
[[Mt 12,1]]Jesus was going through a field of grain on the sabbath. His disciples were hungry and began to pick the heads of grain and eat them.
[[Mt 12,2]]When the Pharisees saw this, they said to him, "See, your disciples are doing what is unlawful to do on the sabbath."
[[Mt 12,3]]He said to them, "Have you not read what David did when he and his companions were hungry,
[[Mt 12,4]]how he went into the house of God and ate the bread of offering, which neither he nor his companions but only the priests could lawfully eat?
[[Mt 12,5]]Or have you not read in the law that on the sabbath the priests serving in the temple violate the sabbath and are innocent?
[[Mt 12,6]]I say to you, something greater than the temple is here.
[[Mt 12,7]]If you knew what this meant, 'I desire mercy, not sacrifice,' you would not have condemned these innocent men.
[[Mt 12,8]]For the Son of Man is Lord of the sabbath."

first_reading.title: Book of Exodus
first_reading.text:
[[Ex 11,10]]Although Moses and Aaron performed various wonders in Pharaoh's presence, the LORD made Pharaoh obstinate, and he would not let the Israelites leave his land.
[[Ex 12,1]]The LORD said to Moses and Aaron in the land of Egypt,
[[Ex 12,2]]"This month shall stand at the head of your calendar; you shall reckon it the first month of the year.
[[Ex 12,3]]Tell the whole community of Israel: On the tenth of this month every one of your families must procure for itself a lamb, one apiece for each household.
[[Ex 12,4]]If a family is too small for a whole lamb, it shall join the nearest household in procuring one and shall share in the lamb in proportion to the number of persons who partake of it.
[[Ex 12,5]]The lamb must be a year-old male and without blemish. You may take it from either the sheep or the goats.
[[Ex 12,6]]You shall keep it until the fourteenth day of this month, and then, with the whole assembly of Israel present, it shall be slaughtered during the evening twilight.
[[Ex 12,7]]They shall take some of its blood and apply it to the two doorposts and the lintel of every house in which they partake of the lamb.
[[Ex 12,8]]That same night they shall eat its roasted flesh with unleavened bread and bitter herbs.
[[Ex 12,9]]It shall not be eaten raw or boiled, but roasted whole, with its head and shanks and inner organs.
[[Ex 12,10]]None of it must be kept beyond the next morning; whatever is left over in the morning shall be burned up.
[[Ex 12,11]]"This is how you are to eat it: with your loins girt, sandals on your feet and your staff in hand, you shall eat like those who are in flight. It is the Passover of the LORD.
[[Ex 12,12]]For on this same night I will go through Egypt, striking down every first--born of the land, both man and beast, and executing judgment on all the gods of Egypt - I, the LORD!
[[Ex 12,13]]But the blood will mark the houses where you are. Seeing the blood, I will pass over you; thus, when I strike the land of Egypt, no destructive blow will come upon you.
[[Ex 12,14]]"This day shall be a memorial feast for you, which all your generations shall celebrate with pilgrimage to the LORD, as a perpetual institution."
